intro: Phlegmariurus ciliolatus, commonly known as the creeping thamnophytes, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a prostrate growth habit, with closely spaced, overlapping leaves that form a dense mat. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a distinctive ciliate margin, giving it its scientific name. This liverwort plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
